course_title: Special Topics: Literature: New Negro Renaissance
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 7 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as AAS 378 1)
(This course examines the art and politics of the New Negro Renaissance (c. 1910s-1930) and Black Arts Movement (c. 1965-1979). We will explore both cultural movements as they intersected with the 20th-century Black freedom struggles, and we will interrogate the scholarly constructions of these movements as literary history. We will study key figures of each movement, including Zora Neale Hurston, Hubert Harrison, Langston Hughes, Gwendolyn Brooks, and Douglas Turner Ward through their poetry, drama, essay, fiction, music, and visual art.)
course_description: Literary topics vary. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
